29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

186254.name: Regret of Infinite Ochema
186254.lore:
No matter how many bodies it steals, its wish remains unfulfilled. Like those who seek the medicines of immortality, it craves an imperishable vessel, one that will rid it of its fear of destruction. And yet, it knows this is a dream that will never come true.

"I have seen countless worlds devoured by The Blemished One's conflagration, and I was one of THEIR flames. I danced at the twirl of THEIR fingers, keenly aware that should the fuel burn out, this fire will also extinguish..."

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

468392.name: Suppressing Edict
468392.desc: Parts used in the Xianzhou ingenium technology. Can be used for the Ascension of Imaginary characters.
468392.lore:
After Rubert unleashed the calamity of inorganic life, the aurumaton in Xianzhou also rebelled and began a ruthless slaughter. To ensure that the turmoil does not resurface, the craftsmen imposed imprisonment using talismans, stripping the aurumaton of their ability to think.

"What on earth did you do to make this fellow go mad?"
"I didn't do anything! I just... cleaned that golden talisman a bit."

549504.name: Immortal Scionette
549504.desc: New and young shoot budding from an ancient divine construct. Crude material used for enhancement.
549504.lore:
The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. Countless years ago, a sovereign's hubris for immortality caused the Xianzhou fleet to sail into the sea of outer space to seek divine recipes.

"We desire to live for endless ages and maintain the empire for all eternity. Unfortunately, human lives have limits and human capacity has its ends. Thus, we send nine Navium Astriger to sail beyond the sky, seeking divine recipes for immortality."
comeFrom: Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

633445.name: Immortal Aeroblossom
633445.desc: New flowers blooming out of an ancient divine construct. Normal material used for enhancement.
633445.lore:
The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. After endless trials, the fleet seeking the medicine of immortality was able to behold the visage of the celestial being. The divine one cast down its blessings in material form, and the Ambrosial Arbor sprouted its leaves.

"New buds descend into the moon, divine flowers bloom by the clouds. In the blink of a blossom's life, old wood returns to youthful grove."
comeFrom: Abominations of Abundance at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

635673.name: Shattered Blade
635673.desc: Weapon fragments left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces slightly for Destruction characters.
635673.lore:
This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The master of this weapon rides on a scarlet horse to ignite cities, to take peace from humankind, and to bring down nations akin to anthills.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with driving peace out of nations."

717386.name: Immortal Lumintwig
717386.desc: Deciduous twigs from an ancient divine construct. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717386.lore:
The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. After the Three Sufferings, Xianzhou laid in devastation. The Homo celestinae fell as demons, and catastrophes occurred ceaselessly.

"As decreed by the Ten-Lords Commission, all who are near the mara-struck state will be seized by the infernal judges and cast into the Shackling Prison."
comeFrom: Abominations of Abundance at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

836259.name: Worldbreaker Blade
836259.desc: Broken weapon left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces significantly for Destruction characters.
836259.lore:
This weapon represents its owner's rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The owner of this weapon makes their appearance at the end of a war to fan the embers to consume the world. Regardless of the glories of the past or the blessing of its deities, this planet is destined to return to the ashes it came from, and to wither away in the depths of the starry sky.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with purifying the world."

920200.name: Lifeless Blade
920200.desc: Weapon remnants left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces moderately for Destruction characters.
920200.lore:
This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The master of this weapon carries a strong hatred for all sentient beings. They relish in the lament of intelligent beings as sweet melodies and topple civilizations with millennia of history in the blink of an eye.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with stopping breath among the living."

ranks.name: Tethered to Sky
ranks.descHash: Increases the stackable Righteous Heart count by <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>, and gains 1 extra stack of Righteous Heart for each hit during an attack.

ranks.name: Imperium On Cloud Nine
ranks.descHash: After using his Ultimate, Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's <u>action advances</u> by <nobr>100%</nobr> and gains 1 extra "Squama Sacrosancta."

ranks.name: Clothed in Clouds
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Zephyr's Bliss
ranks.descHash: The <u>buff</u> effect granted by "Outroar" lasts until the end of this unit's next turn.

ranks.name: Fall is the Pride
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Reign, Returned
ranks.descHash: After another ally character uses their Ultimate, the Imaginary <u>RES PEN</u> of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's next "Fulgurant Leap" attack increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>. This effect can stack up to <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> time(s).

skills.descHash: Uses a 2-hit attack and deals Imaginary DMG equal to #1[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to a single enemy target.
skills.name: Beneficent Lotus

skills.descHash:
Enhances Basic ATK. Enhancements may be applied up to 3 times consecutively. Using this ability does not consume Skill Points and is not considered as using a Skill.
Enhanced once, Beneficent Lotus becomes Transcendence.
Enhanced twice, Beneficent Lotus becomes Divine Spear.
Enhanced thrice, Beneficent Lotus becomes Fulgurant Leap.
When using Divine Spear or Fulgurant Leap, starting from the fourth hit, 1 stack of Outroar is gained before every hit. Each stack of Outroar increases Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's CRIT DMG by #1[f1]%, for a max of #2[i] stacks. These stacks last until the end of his turn.
skills.name: Dracore Libre

skills.descHash:
Uses a 3-hit attack and deals Imaginary DMG equal to #1[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to a single enemy target. At the same time, deals Imaginary DMG equal to #2[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to adjacent targets. Then, obtains #3[i] Squama Sacrosancta.
It's possible to hold up to #4[i] Squama Sacrosancta, which can be used to offset Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's consumption of skill points. Consuming Squama Sacrosancta is considered equivalent to consuming skill points.
skills.name: Azure's Aqua Ablutes All

skills.descHash: After each hit dealt during an attack, Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae gains 1 stack of Righteous Heart, increasing his DMG by #1[f1]%. This effect can stack up to #2[i] time(s), lasting until the end of his turn.
skills.name: Righteous Heart

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: After using his Technique, Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae enters the Leaping Dragon state for #2[i] seconds. While in the Leaping Dragon state, using his attack enables him to move forward rapidly for a set distance, attacking all enemies he touches and blocking all incoming attacks. After entering combat via attacking enemies in the Leaping Dragon state, Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae deals Imaginary DMG equal to #3[i]% of his ATK to all enemies, and gains #1[i] Squama Sacrosancta.
skills.name: Heaven-Quelling Prismadrakon

skills.descHash: Uses a 3-hit attack and deals Imaginary DMG equal to #1[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to a single enemy target.
skills.name: Transcendence

skills.descHash: Uses a 5-hit attack and deals Imaginary DMG equal to #1[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to a single enemy target. From the fourth hit onward, simultaneously deals Imaginary DMG equal to #2[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to adjacent targets.
skills.name: Divine Spear

skills.descHash: Uses a 7-hit attack and deals Imaginary DMG equal to #1[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to a single enemy target. From the fourth hit onward, simultaneously deal Imaginary DMG equal to #2[i]% of Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae's ATK to adjacent targets.
skills.name: Fulgurant Leap

embedBonusSkill.descHash: At the start of the battle, immediately regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy.
embedBonusSkill.name: Star Veil

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Increases the chance to resist <u>Crowd Control debuffs</u> by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Aqua Reign

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When dealing DMG to enemy targets with Imaginary Weakness, CRIT DMG increases by #1[i]%.
embedBonusSkill.name: Jolt Anew

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: This is my original appearance, that of the Vidyadhara... Don't worry, I'm still Dan Heng, a descendant of the Vidyadhara, and also a member of the Nameless.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: As recorded in the data bank, it is customary among the Vidyadhara to place one's hand on one's forehead when greeting someone. But... we don't need to do that.

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: It's getting late, I won't be staying up much longer. Sleep well.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Previous Life
voiceItems.text: My previous life is like a faint shadow — hardly visible yet following me wherever I go. It's hard to describe the feeling, but one thing is for certain — I am nobody's shadow.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Banishment
voiceItems.text: The eternal banishment decree was like a pardon for me... After all, I'm here now, aren't I?

voiceItems.title: Chat: Cloud-Piercer
voiceItems.text: There is unfinished business between me and the maker of this weapon.

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: During my days in The Shackling Prison, reading books was my only respite from the long hours and the shadows of the past.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: I have no interest in commenting on the deeds and sins of Imbibitor Lunae. Given the choice, I would like to cast his name aside... Even so, the consequences of his power will be borne by me alone.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: The Vidyadhara that reside on the Xianzhou received a blessing from the Permanence — our dragon ancestor. On the Luofu, we wield a magic known as "cloudhymn" that allows us to manipulate water and control the rains.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: The Ambrosial Arbor was severed long ago, but it is not dead. If there is any activity from the Denizens of Abundance, it will be connected to the Arbor.

voiceItems.title: About Jing Yuan
voiceItems.text: Sometimes the general treats me as a friend from the old days. Unfortunately, I am unable to return the sentiment.

voiceItems.title: About Bailu
voiceItems.text: The high elder succession was incomplete, causing her to become trapped in shallow waters... Fortunately, she has a vitality that does not bend to the will of others.

voiceItems.title: About Yanqing
voiceItems.text: That young swordmaster has a keen eye and a swift hand, but I have no desire to compete with anyone in a sword fight.

voiceItems.title: About Blade
voiceItems.text: What he seeks I am unable to provide.

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: One cannot pick and choose their recollections. My past is unalterable.

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: The unrest within me seeks an escape.

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: The future is unknowable... but I have a choice.

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: I will pay the price for this power.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Trailblazer, proceed with caution. I've got your back.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With March 7th
voiceItems.text: March, remember that— *sigh* Forget it, you never remember.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Himeko
voiceItems.text: As always, Himeko, I can handle it.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Welt
voiceItems.text: Mr. Yang, do you have any insight into this? Allow me to explain my thinking.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Jing Yuan
voiceItems.text: Good to see you, General.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Blade
voiceItems.text: This is your last warning. Stay away from my companions.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: The times are changed beyond recognition.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: Do not be afraid.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: I sense a storm...

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: I wish not to use this strength.

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Conflict requires undivided focus.

voiceItems.title: Enhanced Basic Attack 2
voiceItems.text: You are flawed.

voiceItems.title: Enhanced Basic Attack 3: Activation
voiceItems.text: The heavens surge...

voiceItems.title: Enhanced Basic Attack 3: Unleash (I)
voiceItems.text: Celestial dragon... Break!

voiceItems.title: Enhanced Basic Attack 3: Unleash (II)
voiceItems.text: Cloud-faring dragon... rise!

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: A graze.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: Inevitable.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: Awaken, dormant scales.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: Delve-hidden moon, world-cleansing dragon!

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: Not yet... not now.

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: A dragon... will always return.

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Do not fret.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Water heeds the cloud's song...

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: The consequences are mine to bear.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: It's all yours.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: This could serve you well.

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: A fine piece.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: Good.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: All manner of mystic arts have their own distinctive merits.

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: Caution does not mean cowardice.

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: All remains as it did yesterday...

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
Dan Heng's true Vidyadhara form, revealed after accepting the residual powers from the previous reincarnation of "Imbibitor Lunae."
Upon accepting the majestic horned crown atop his forehead, he must accept all the merits and faults attributed to that person.
However, he was never himself.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
In the dim abyss devoid of light, he seemed to have returned to the insides of a Vidyadhara egg, being ceaselessly churned in tumultuous waves and elusive dreams.

He dreamed he was standing before a sacrificial altar, dancing and chanting. However, the songs and gestures were mere facades. The light emanating from his eyes and the storm roiling in his blood were the true forces at play. Casually, he wove the misty and foggy tide in Scalegorge Waterscape, sealing the maddened and frenzied "dragon" into the propagating giant tree. As the echoing roar streamed up into the heavens and dissipated, Scalegorge Waterscape will continue its peace for centuries more, and his duty was over.

The ceremony ended, and he turned to look behind him. In the blink of an eye, the stairs he had stepped down from had become full of standing dignitaries with draconic horns and dressed like royalty. As if they were mirages in a mirror, each of them turned and their sleeves swirled with the motion, ready to leave one after another in a meticulously calculated arrangement. Innumerable, they formed a staircase to the sky, stretching into the never-ending spatial void. The faces of all these people would greet him every morning in his dressing mirror — That was his face.

No, it was the face of the primordial, the original, the very first high elder. He smiled bitterly and covered his face with his palm, as if ascertaining whether he could tear off this mask and return it to its true owner.

He could not.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
In the dim abyss devoid of light, he seemed to have returned to the insides of a Vidyadhara egg, being ceaselessly churned in tumultuous waves and elusive dreams.

He dreamed he arrived at the battlefield like the descent of a god. He hovered with the clouds — the military formations below him were tiny as ants, and the airborne chariots and starskiffs were moths destined to die in a flame. Such were the lives of mortals... Was this the viewpoint of a dragon? A sliver of hubris rose up and plunged his heart into emotionless and icy detachment, and he hurriedly cast his gaze toward those with whom he had fought and shared liquor:

The pilot who zoomed past did not care whether the formation was orderly. She shot at will, letting the arrows filled with blazing fire fall on the storming borisin foot soldiers...

Along the direction pointed out by the starskiffs, a white-haired swordswoman spearheaded into the fray ahead of the entire army, dancing with her sharp blade. She dashed between flashes of metallic light, her actions too sharp to even let her allies come near, reducing them to merely supporting her from behind...

On the other hand, the Cloud Knight Lieutenant who used to chat and laugh with the dragon contained his languid indolence, holding his devastator glaive in hand as he stood with his men to repel the borisin pawns attacking from the battlefield's wings...

And behind the main host, the military engineers who marched with the army were adjusting and testing giant aurumatons... perhaps that exceedingly arrogant craftsman was now working at full speed, for these machines hundreds of feet tall are specialized weapons designed to counter the mechabeasts...

Then, he saw the general of yesteryear, Teng Xiao. He was enveloped in golden lightning like the avatar of the Reignbow, plowing through the enemies' rows of war beasts with his divine mirage...

The devastated borisin began to flee. He knew it was time to carry out the duty entrusted to him. So he let go — letting his consciousness disappear in storms and hails, letting thunder roar for him, letting tsunamis rage for him. He floated on top of clouds, watching the enemies getting swallowed by the watery abyss, and watching the land behind him. Many humans, Vidyadhara, and foxians were eternally left there, unable to lay their eyes upon their home ever again.

The dragon heart told him that it was but a small speck of dust brushed away from the world. Wars come with a price, but life will always thrive once more — the Vidyadhara are not the only branch of Long's Scions. However, his human heart ached for those comrades who, like him, had warm flesh and blood, and for those mortals who might have lived longer but now could return home nevermore.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
In the dim abyss devoid of light, he seemed to have returned to the insides of a Vidyadhara egg, being ceaselessly churned in tumultuous waves and elusive dreams.

He dreamed that he parted the ocean's waters and came to the palace ruin depths, burying the remnants of his old friend's hallowed blood, or creating a new life that had not been seen for millennia — or, perhaps, those two actions were one and the same, an unattainable desire that could not be carried out for long years in the past, a final straw that broke the gargantuan dragon's back. The craftsman was covered in blood and wounds as he guarded the dragon with a sword in his hand. He urged himself to commit to the decision.

"Shuhu is dead... we won, but how many more victories can we manage to achieve? How many more prices like this must we pay?"
"Look, the Ambrosial Arbor still stands. So long as it is alive, the monsters... they can come back again and again. The war of the Xianzhou natives, foxians, and Vidyadhara against the abominations will never end."
"Yes, none of us are special! Each of us has only one life, sacrificing for this, dying for that... it's all our own choices. Just like how she chose to save you and Jingliu... just like how she chose to let more people live on!"

War, and the lives that expired in the war, were living beings just like him.
He shut his eyes wearily, remembering their faces, and made up his mind.
"If there's a chance... we will also choose to let her and more people live on.
We, the Vidyadhara, have our own way of salvation. I can give it a try."

Like an out-of-body experience, like a dream within a dream, he returned to the moment before his sense of self disappeared. With a cold and emotionless mind, he observed himself turning into a dragon, entangled and fighting claw-and-fangs against that bulb of shapeshifting shadow of flesh and blood. In an illusion seen on the verge of death, the emissary of the god showed him an unsettling, beautiful scene — the stars pulsated and sang hymns like red blood cells, and the universe descended into an abyss of flesh and desires. The dragon heart beat to its limit, raising its fangs, breath, and fury — however, no matter how mighty it was, a "lifeform" cannot defy the true body of god of life's envoy.

...Until a starskiff ran everything through like an arrow shaft. He saw that girl crawling out of the ruins with great difficulty, lifting a "sun" of absolute darkness in her hand. In that fleeting eternity, he saw her hand disappear, saw her face disappear, and saw her disappear — That item had ground everything around it into the finest dust and dragged them into a vortex of raw power, including that girl.

A tuft of hair and a few drops of blood fell to the floor as evidence of her existence. Those were the only traces she left.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
In the dim abyss devoid of light, he seemed to have returned to the insides of a Vidyadhara egg, being ceaselessly churned in tumultuous waves and elusive dreams.

He dreamed of the Dracocatena Nails being staked into his body, and chains of corallium winding around him to hang him in midair in the Shackling Prison. He dreamed the elders coming and going to interrogate him about the truth of the Arcanum and the whereabouts of the dragon heart. He did not speak.

He dreamed of the Judges coming before him to read their decision and wanting to sentence him to death. He did not speak.

He dreamed of the white-haired Cloud Knight Lieutenant coming to visit him and bringing him news of the Lieutenant's negotiations. The Vidyadhara did not permit him to die, nor did they permit him to leave. He did not speak.

He dreamed he was raising his cup to drink with the others again, that he molted off his scales, and that he returned to the egg, and became someone else.

He dreamed many, many things, like a never-ending immersia entitled "Self."

Following the immersia was an even clearer but unreachable illusion.

He saw himself being exiled. He saw himself boarding an express. He saw himself running into the endless stars, never looking back.

name: Dan Heng • Imbibitor Lunae
descHash: Dan Heng's true form from his Vidyadhara lineage carries the residual power left behind by his past incarnation, the Imbibitor Lunae. Upon accepting the majestic horns atop his crown, he must accept all the merits and faults attributed to that sinner.
